metadata.Title: CVE-2023-37922 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: Multiple arbitrary write vulnerabilities exist in the VCD sorted bsearchfunctionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .vcd file can lead toarbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a malicious file totrigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns the arbitrarywrite when triggered via the vcd2lxt2 conversion utility.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
